intro: Monotagma, commonly known as the African orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, particularly in the southern and eastern parts of the continent. The plants are characterized by their tall, erect stems and showy, often fragrant flowers that come in a variety of colors. Monotagma species typically thrive in moist, well-drained soils and prefer full sun to partial shade. They are valued not only for their ornamental beauty but also for their ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
